labels.analysis: The MCP Server focuses on interacting with the OSO Cloud API to manage and query authorization policies. Its tools allow users to check permissions dynamically, list accessible resources, and retrieve available actions, making it a specialized tool for authorization management and access control. The natural language interface suggests ease of use for non-technical users.
labels.reasoning: The primary label **Security & Authentication** is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around authorization and access control. Secondary labels **API Integration** and **Operating System** are added because it interacts with an external API and may interface with system resources. No custom label is needed as predefined categories cover the functionality well.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Oso Cloud MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @robinbortlik/oso-cloud-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Easily understand your authorization by querying the OSO Cloud API using natural language.

tools.name: get_policy
tools.description: Deploy Server Oso Cloud MCP Server @robinbortlik/oso-cloud-mcp Try in Playground

tools.name: authorize
tools.description: Check if an actor can perform an action on a resource

tools.name: list_resources
tools.description: List resources of a specific type that an actor can perform an action on

tools.name: get_actions
tools.description: Get all actions an actor can perform on a resource

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@robinbortlik/oso-cloud-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
